snippet.title: Super Compact Raspberry Pi 3 'Slim' Is Just 7mm Thick
snippet.content:
The Raspberry Pi is already a fairly tiny piece of hardware, but with some tinkering, it's possible to go even smaller. Modder NODE, , has a new project doing the rounds - a fully-functional Raspberry Pi 3 that's a mere 7mm thick.
As the video above explains, - so all the external ports, essentially. This includes the ethernet and USB connectors, which for this mod were "sawn off":
A custom 3D-printed case holds everything in place, the major feature a top-facing grill to keep the "notoriously warm Pi 3" cool.
Image: NODE
While NODE doesn't provide explicit instructions, . Considering the mod requires mutilating the board, it's definitely not for the faint of heart.
